summary.para: The get_KeyFrameRate method retrieves the current key-frame rate.

param.name: pKeyFrameRate
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the current key-frame rate. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default key-frame rate. If the value is zero, only the first frame is a key frame.

remarks.para: The key-frame rate is the number of frames per key frame. For example, if the rate is 15, then a key frame occurs every 15 frames.

To determine if the filter supports this method, call the method and check for the CompressionCaps_CanKeyFrame flag in the pCapabilities parameter. The GetInfo method also returns the default key-frame rate.

summary.para: The get_PFramesPerKeyFrame method retrieves the rate of predicted (P) frames per key frame.

param.name: pPFramesPerKeyFrame
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of P frames per key frame. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default rate.

remarks.para: To determine if the filter supports this method, call the method and check for the CompressionCaps_CanBFrame flag in the pCapabilities parameter. The GetInfo method also returns the default P-frame rate.

P frames are used in MPEG compression; in general, this property does not apply to other compression formats. For example, suppose a key frame occurs once every 10 frames, and there are three P frames per key frame. The P frames will be spaced evenly between the key frames. The remaining six frames are bidirectional (B) frames.

summary.para: The get_Quality method retrieves the current compression quality.

param.name: pQuality
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the relative compression quality. The quality is expressed as a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 indicates the best quality and 0.0 indicates the worst quality. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default quality.

remarks.para: The exact meaning of the quality setting depends on the filter.
To determine if the filter supports this method, call the method and check for the CompressionCaps_CanQuality flag in the pCapabilities parameter. The GetInfo method also returns the default quality.

summary.para: The get_WindowSize method retrieves the number of frames over which the compressor will maintain the average data rate.

For example, assuming a data rate of 100K/sec and a frame rate of 10 frames per second, if the window size is 1, then every frame will be 10K or less. If the window size is 5, then every five consecutive frames will average 10K per frame, but individual frames may exceed this size.

param.name: pWindowSize
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the window size, expressed as a number of frames.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The OverrideFrameSize method overrides the frame size of a specified frame.

param.name: FrameNumber
param.para: Specifies the frame number. The first frame that the filter delivers is numbered zero.

param.name: Size
param.para: Specifies the maximum size of the specified frame, in bytes.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: If the filter supports this method, the method will return the CompressionCaps_CanCrunch flag in the pCapabilities parameter. However, this flag can also indicate that the filter supports setting the bit rate, so it does not guarantee that the OverrideFrameSize method is supported.

summary.para: The OverrideKeyFrame method instructs the filter to compress a particular frame as a key frame.

param.name: FrameNumber
param.para: Specifies the frame number. The first frame that the filter delivers is numbered zero.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: If the filter supports this method, you can use it to override the normal key-frame distribution for a particular frame. After the filter creates a key frame, it might reset its count to determine when the next key frame should occur. For example, if the key-frame rate is 10, and an application uses this method to force frame 5 as a key frame, the filter might wait another 10 frames (until frame 15) before it creates the next key frame.

summary.para: The put_KeyFrameRate method sets the key-frame rate.

param.name: KeyFrameRate
param.para: Desired key-frame rate. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default key-frame rate. If the value is zero, only the first frame will be a key frame.

remarks.para: To determine if the filter supports this method, call the method and check for the CompressionCaps_CanKeyFrame flag in the pCapabilities parameter. The GetInfo method also returns the default key-frame rate.

summary.para: The put_PFramesPerKeyFrame method sets the rate of predicted (P) frames per key frame.

param.name: PFramesPerKeyFrame
param.para: Specifies the number of P frames per key frame. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default rate.

remarks.para: To determine if the filter supports this method, call the method and check for the CompressionCaps_CanBFrame flag in the pCapabilities parameter. The GetInfo method also returns the default P-frame rate.

summary.para: The put_Quality method sets the compression quality.

param.name: Quality
param.para: Specifies the quality as a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 indicates the best quality and 0.0 indicates the worst quality. If the value is negative, the filter will use the default quality.

remarks.para: To determine if the filter supports this method, call the method and check for the CompressionCaps_CanQuality flag in the pCapabilities parameter. The GetInfo method also returns the default quality.

summary.para: The put_WindowSize method sets the number of frames over which the compressor must maintain an average data rate.

For example, assuming a data rate of 100K/sec and a frame rate of 10 frames per second, if the window size is 1, then every frame will be 10K or less. If the window size is 5, then every five consecutive frames must average 10K per frame, but individual frames may exceed this size.

param.name: WindowSize
param.para: Specifies the window size, expressed as a number of frames. .

summary.para: The IAMVideoCompression interface sets and retrieves video compression properties. It is supported by some video compression filters, and also by some video capture filters that output compressed video. Filters that support this interface expose it through their output pins.
An application can use this interface to control how video is compressed, including characteristics such as the key-frame rate or the compression quality.
A filter that supports this interface might not support every method. Use the method to determine which methods the filter supports.
Note To use this interface on a capture filter, you might need to connect the filter to another filter in the graph.

remarks.para: For Windows Driver Model (WDM) devices, the WDM Video Capture Filter automatically exposes this interface if the WDM driver supports the PROPSETID_VIDCAP_VIDEOCOMPRESSION property set. For more information, see the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) documentation.
